column4: There was a fatal error when doing sudo modprove ndiswrapper. There was an invalid argument.
have you set up your card yet, in ndiswrapper? given it the driver, etc?
No
I don't know where to find the driver. That is a problem I am having/
you get the driver from the manufacturer's CD or site...
Tritium, I did yes.
I see.
I will do that now then. I am very sorry about this. I am new to Ubuntu.
no problem. Ndiswrapper isn't a wireless driver, it's something that lets you use Windows wireless card drivers in linux.
did you get that link I sent out earlier? It contains ndisgtk, it makes it a -tad- easier, and it also includes some other useful wifi packages.
http://bhs2007.googlepages.com/edgy-wifi.zip
It is telling me that HArdware isn't present. Although it is.
hmm. and you gave it the proper .inf file?
I dragged it into the blank white area and it was trying to install.
ah, it's a belkin...
Yeah...
It now says HArdware PResent.
Although I don't know what to do next...
did you get that link I sent you earlier
Yeah
Do I install all of the packages on there?
it contains network-manager-gnome, you'll want that.
Righty Ill install that and report back:)
aye aye.
just make sure to say my name in here, so I'll notice.
Ah, it tells me the Dependency is not satisfyable: network Manager.
all the dependencies are in that archive.
Do i need to put all of the .deb packages from the zipped file onto Ubuntu?
pretty much... do all except for wifi-radar for now.
Should I place all of the packages on my desktop?
you can place them all in some directory if you want, and you can install them all at once with a command, or just double click them.
the desktop will work fine.
I am installing them now.
BHSPITLappy: It keeps telling me that Software Channel is not available. YEt they do install...
No ignore me I read it wrong.
okay
I have a problem with: wpagui. It tells me there is an Error: Dependency is not satisfiable: libqt4-core.
What do I do next?
push ALT+F2, and run nm-applet using it
The NetworkManager applet could not find some required resources. It cannot continue.
I had a problem with one of the packages.
screw the required resources! I give up!
Could someone help me to get ndiswrapper working properly so that I can get my wireless working?
it -might- help to log off and/or reboot at this point.  Can't promise anything, though
Would it have made any difference of wpagui wouldn't install?
not really
that one wasn't tied in with the others
It didn't work. Thanks all the same.
oh, sorry to hear that.  I didn't even realize it was USB
Yeah it is...
I am guessing it is a bad thing.
type ifconfig in a  terminal
let's see if ndiswrapper created any interfaces for it
There is eth0 and some writing and Lo with some writing. There are no bytes on the eth0 however there is a small amount of packets and bytes.
There is a small amount of packets and bytes on the Lo one - BHSPITLAPPY
try sudo modprobe ndiswrapper and then try again
eth0 is probably your ethernet, and lo is just loopback- your machine
Fatal Error
I see.
When I type sudo modprobe ndiswrapper the fatal error I receive is : /lib/modules/2.6.17.10-generic/kernel/drivers/ndiswrapper/ndiswrapper.ko : invalid argument.
